verb.description: Mark (something) with colored patches or dirty marks that are not easily removed.
examples: her clothing was stained with blood

verb.description: Color (a material or object) by applying a penetrative dye or chemical.
examples: wood can always be stained to a darker shade

noun.description: A colored patch or dirty mark that is difficult to remove.
examples: there were mud stains on my shoes

noun.description: A penetrative dye or chemical used in coloring a material or object.

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb): shortening of archaic distain, from Old French desteindre tinge with a color different from the natural one. The noun was first recorded (mid 16th century) in the sense defilement, disgrace.
